items.question: Which questioning practice promotes more class interaction?

choices.text: Asking the question before calling on a student.

items.question: Which technique should a teacher use to encourage response if students do not respond to his question?

choices.text: Ask another student to answer the question.
Ask another question, an easier one.
Tell the class there will be a test.

items.question: Which type of questions are generally considered low-level?
Which of the following is a "fact" question?

choices.text: What are some of the ways in which you have used the word ancient?
What are the effects of the invention of electricity on the life of people?
What is the function of the CPU in a microcomputer?
What would be one of the first things we have to do to clean the air we breathe?

items.question: In the class of Mrs. Eduave, she asked the question, "How can you distinguish facts and opinions in the study presented?" How is this question classified?
Inquiry lessons require the use of questions in instructing the learner to analyze, interpret, and draw conclusions from the data gathered. Which type of questions asks for additional data?
A sufficient wait time can achieve the following EXCEPT

choices.text: Decreases the amount of guessing or wrong inferences
Discourages slow and fast thinking students to respond
Increase the number of correct responses
Provides time for teachers to evaluate the answers given

items.question: Teacher B asked this question, "What conclusion can you draw based on your observation?" Nobody raised a hand so she asked another question, "Based on what you observed, what can you now say about the reaction of plants to light?" Which did Teacher B do?
Which practice contributes to an interactive lesson?

choices.text: Asking more rhetorical type of questions.
Asking more divergent type of questions.
Calling on a student to answer before asking a question.
Asking more convergent type of questions.

items.question: Which statement holds TRUE to probing?

choices.text: It is done before a student gives a response.
It is meant to clarify further the question.
It restructures the student's response in a more productive direction.

items.question: Which questioning practice will promote more class interaction?

choices.text: Asking the questions before calling on a student answer

items.question: To nurture students' creativity, which activity should a teacher AVOID?

choices.text: Emphasize the need to give the right answer
Be open to "out of this world" ideas

items.question: The commonly-used question-and-answer method includes debate and discussion consonance with the method of
If a teacher asks more higher-order questions, he has to ask more _____ questions.
Which of the following should be avoided by the teacher in asking questions?

choices.text: Repeat questions if pupils cannot answer
Encourage lengthy response and sustained answer
Ask the question first before calling a student to answer
Ask a sufficient number of questions to stimulate thinking

items.question: I want to elicit more student responses. Which one should I AVOID?

choices.text: Prompting to convert wrong answers to correct ones

items.question: Which one can help students develop the habit of critical thinking?
Which questioning technique would be appropriate for inductive lessons?

choices.text: Expect participation only among the more motivated students.
Involve students actively in the questioning process.
As a teacher, you ask no questions.

items.question: Instead of a teacher giving this comment to a student response: "You're on the wrong track!" What should a teacher do?

choices.text: Change the question to an easier one
Redirect the question by calling another student to recite
Probe to redirect the response into a more productive area
Pause-ask the question, lecture, then ask the question again

items.question: To encourage class participation, which should a teacher NEVER do?

choices.text: Reject a student's response at once

items.question: The following are sound specific purposes of questions EXCEPT _____.

choices.text: to call the attention of an inactive student
to stimulate learners to ask questions

items.question: Which question is in the highest level of Bloom's taxonomy of objectives in the cognitive domain?

choices.text: What two groups are present in an experimental design?
What could have happened if there was no control group?
Distinguish between control and experimental group.
Judge the validity of the experimental design.

items.question: When a teacher elicits clarification on a student response or solicits additional information, what is he engaged in?
When a teacher elicits clarification on a student response or solicits additional information, what is he engaged in?
Which is NOT a sound purpose for asking questions?

choices.text: to probe deeper after an answer is given
to discipline a bully in class
to remind students of a procedure

items.question: Which objective in the affective domain is in the lowest level?

choices.text: to respond positively to a comment

items.question: The practice of motivating students before we can proceed to our lesson proper is in accordance with the law of
For greater accountability of learning, our lesson objecives must be SMART. T stands for _____.
If there is truth to the statement, "A picture is worth a thousand words" then for effective teaching, what should teachers do?

choices.text: make use of visual aids as often as they can
remain abstract in their teaching method
hand many pictures of heroes on the wall

items.question: The teaching machines of Skinner provided _____ instruction.

To develop higher-level thinking skill among students, which type of questions should be discouraged?

A student memorized the pairs of nucleic acids in the DNA by using initials of his loved ones, which device did he use?
Which activity is most appropriate if I want my students to get a graphic overview of the whole lesson on figures of speech before I discuss them one by one?

The lesson is on the PROS and CONS of the government's all out war against the MILF. Mr. Pabillaran wants to do high level thinking and to develop a view of the all out war from different perspectives. Which technique will be most appropriate?

For integrative purposes, which method/approach should be used?

Read this question: "How will you present the layers of the earth to your class?"
Which of the following refers to the orderly procedures and steps used by the teacher to make the learning process more meaningful and interesting?

Which is a characteristic of the constructivist teaching apporach?
I. Metacognitive
II. Reflective
III. Integrative
For maximum interaction, a teacher ought to avoid _____ questions.
Research tells that teachers ask mostly content questions. Which of the following terms does NOT refer to content question?
Which of the following is the essential feature of the eclectic emthod?

choices.text: it is the most used method
it is applicable to all types of learner
it combines all the best features of all other methods
it is recommended by curriculum experts

items.question: In large classes where little of the work can be individualized, the most effective and practical way to individualize instruction is to

choices.text: give the students freedom to launch individual projects
devise group acitivities which afford every student an opportunity to work at this own level
assign homework and check it regularly
assign programmed material for out-of-class hours

items.question: When should a teacher decide to use direct instruction as a method?

choices.text: when the students will be able to contribute substantially to the lesson
when the teacher is an expert in direct isntruction

items.question: Which describe(s) inappropriate practice in the education of young children?

choices.text: individual differences are expected and accepted

items.question: Which practice does NOT fit in a classroom that recognizes individual differences?
Which is  a classroom application of this principle, "Students learn more effectively when they elaborate on new information." Ask your students to

choices.text: print the principle in bigger letters then put in a place where they can read it time and again
identify an application of the principle

items.question: Which learning principles is the essence of Gardner's theory of multiple intelligences?

choices.text: Almost all learners are linguistically intelligent
Intelligence is not measured in one form

items.question: You have presented a lesson on animal protective coloration. At the end, you ask if there are any questions. There are none. You can take this to mean that _____.

choices.text: the students are not interested in the lesson
the students did not understand what you were talking about
the students understood everything you presented
you need to ask specific questions to elicit responses

items.question: You want your students to answer questions at the end of a reading lesson. "What did I learn today?", "What still puzzles me?", "What did I enjoy, hate, accomplish in class today?", "How did I learn from the lesson?" Which of the following are you asking them to do?

choices.text: draw plant's response to light then explain
show pictures of plants growing towards the light, then ask students to draw their conclusions on plant's response to light
state plant's response to light then prove by showing examples
make my students share their research on phototropism and ask one another questions

items.question: Which statement on motivation is backed up by research?

choices.text: How should you present a report in class?
What condition must be met for reporting method to be effective?
What steps are followed in class reporting?
Was the student reporting well done? Support your answer.

items.question: Meaningfulness is the key to all cognitive processes. Meaningfulness depends on _____.

choices.text: Provides for meeting pupil different interests

items.question: Knowledge is innate in the soul. Provoke people into thinking for themselves rather than teach them they did not already know, said one Greek philosopher. What is the application of this in the classroom today? Use of _____.
Which does NOT hold true to collaborative learning?

choices.text: Each student is held accountable for what is to be learned?
The members of the group have face-to-face interaction.
Success of the group depends on one diligent student.

choices.text: fill the minds of the learner with information
make the learning task easy for the learner
dictate what to learn upon the learner
help the learner connect what she/he knows new information from the teacher

choices.text: limited to two questions per student
answered by the leader in detail
asked by the leader and answered by the student

choices.text: the meaning of the law of supply and demand

items.question: The following are characteristics of interdisciplinary teaching EXCEPT
